page.title: 09AN OLD RESIDENT OF SHROTON
page.content: WE SPOKE TO A MAN WHO LIVES IN A COTTAGE BY THE POST OFFICE. HE IS NOW OVER 80 AND HAS LIVED IN SHROTON ALL HIS LIFE. HE CAN BE SEEN MOST DAYS SITTING ON THE BENCH OUTSIDE HIS HOUSE OR CYCLING ROUND THE VILLAGE. HE LOVES TO TALK ABOUT HIS YOUTH AND REMEMBERS PLAYING IN THE FIELDS OR IN THE BARNS WHEN IT RAINED. MARBLES WAS HIS FAVOURITE WET DAY GAME. HE HAD TO WALK EVERYWHERE AND WAS TOLD BY HIS MOTHER TO KEEP OFF THE ROADS AND ON THE FOOTPATHS TO SAVE HIS HOBNAILED BOOTS. HE ATTENDED THE VILLAGE SCHOOL AND THINKS THE VILLAGE LOST MUCH OF ITS LIFE WHEN THE SCHOOL CLOSED. HE BECAME A FARMWORKER BUT HAS NOW RETIRED. HE IS STILL A BELLRINGER AT THE CHURCH BUT HE IS VERY SAD THAT THE CHILDREN DO NOT COME TO CHURCH AS THEY DID WHEN HE WAS YOUNG.
